instructions.notes:
Cut lemongrass to leave you with just the bottom 8 cm. Peel off the reedy outer layers, then trim the tough base off, leaving you with a pale green/white stem. This part will be used for the paste. The trimmings are used in the beef braising broth.
This curry is not supposed to be spicy, just a warm hum. This recipe is made with the generic Asian dried chillies purchased from Asian grocery stores which are usually not that spicy.
Massaman is supposed to be made with large pieces of meat, rather than small bite size pieces, so the meat needs to be slow cooked to become tender and absorbs the flavour of the braising liquid. Can be substituted with brisket but make sure you trim off the thick layer of fat, otherwise the sauce ends up too greasy. Gravy beef is also suitable, as long as you can find large pieces.

steps.action: Remove reedy outer layers and trim
steps.postAction: Reserve all the trimmings (for beef). Finely chop the white part (for paste).
Liquid should almost cover beef but not completely.

steps.action: Add lemongrass trimmings. Bring to boil over high heat, then reduce heat and simmer gently for 1.5 – 2 hours until beef is fork tender.
steps.postAction: Remove beef. If there’s much more than 1.5 cups liquid, simmer to reduce. Set liquid aside.

steps.action: Place heavy based skillet over high heat until smoking (no oil). Add

steps.action: Grate galangal/ginger, peel garlic, break chillies in half, shake out seeds and discard.
Heat a skillet on medium heat and add
steps.postAction: Toast for 30 seconds or until they start to smell fragrant – do not let them burn. Immediately transfer into bowl.

steps.action: Blend chillies in food processor until finely chopped. Add galangal/ginger, garlic, finely chopped lemongrass, eschalots, the toasted spices and 5 tbsp water and blend to a paste.
Place oil in a pot or large skillet over medium high heat. Add curry paste and cook for 3 minutes until the liquid has cooked out and it’s thick and fragrant.

steps.postAction: Also add reserved beef braising liquid. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 3 minutes.
Cook for 7 minutes or until potatoes are tender, turning as required.

steps.action: Add beef and simmer for 2 minutes or until sauce has reduced and thickened.
steps.postAction: Adjust: saltiness with fish sauce, sour with tamarind and sweet with sugar. The taste should be sweet, salty and sour, with more emphasis on the sweet and sour notes.
